revision.text:
{{good article}} [[File:Coast Guard Festival Parade.jpg|thumb|Children wave the [[flag of the United States Coast Guard]] during the Grand Haven, Michigan Coast Guard Festival Parade in 2013. In 1998 Grand Haven became the first city designated a "Coast Guard City."]] A '''Coast Guard City''' is a [[United States]] [[municipality]] designated as such by the [[Commandant of the United States Coast Guard]] on application of the local civilian government. It is an honorary designation intended to recognize communities of special importance to the U.S. Coast Guard. ==Criteria== Designation as a Coast Guard City is made by the Commandant of the United States Coast Guard on advise of a review board and upon application by a municipal government.{{cite web|title=Coast Guard City Program|url=http://www.thecityofnewport.net/dept/adm/CoastGuardCityProgram.asp|website=thecityofnewport.net|publisher=City of Newport|accessdate=24 August 2015}}{{cite web|title=Coast Guard Cities|url=http://www.military.com/coast-guard-birthday/coast-guard-cities.html|website=military.com|publisher=military.com|accessdate=24 August 2015}} According to the U.S. Coast Guard, applications are expected to demonstrate an applicant jurisdiction's ability to meet a multi-part criteria that can include: erection of monuments and memorials to the Coast Guard, organization of civic celebrations on the anniversary of the founding of the U.S. Coast Guard, offer of special recognition and merchandise discounts to Coast Guard personnel by the local business community, providing support to local U.S. Coast Guard [[Morale, Welfare and Recreation]] initiatives.{{cite web|title=Frequently Asked Questions|url=http://www.uscg.mil/community/FAQ.asp#Q_16|website=uscg.mil|publisher=[[United States Coast Guard]]|accessdate=24 August 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Lundstrom|first1=Jim|title=City Celebrates Coast Guard Designation|url=http://www.ppulse.com/Articles-Headlines-c-2014-05-07-114987.114136-City-Celebrates-Coast-Guard-Designation.html|accessdate=25 August 2015|work=Peninsula Pulse|date=9 May 2014}} Designation as a Coast Guard City is for a five-year period, but can be renewed indefinitely conditioned on the city continuing to meet the criteria. ==History== [[File:USCGCCitySign.JPG|thumb|left|A sign in [[Astoria, Oregon]] designating that city as a "Coast Guard City."]] ===Background=== The Coast Guard City program was established by the [[United States Congress]] in 1998 to recognize cities where military assets of the [[United States Coast Guard]] are located and which demonstrate support to Coast Guard personnel stationed there.{{cite news|last1=Degener|first1=Richard|title=Cape May mayor wants 'Coast Guard Community' designation for town|url=http://www.pressofatlanticcity.com/news/press/cape_may/cape-may-mayor-wants-coast-guard-community-designation-for-town/article_6b4e9892-f2ee-11e2-8991-001a4bcf887a.html|accessdate=24 August 2015|work=[[Press of Atlantic City]]|date=22 July 2013}} The first city so designated was [[Grand Haven, Michigan]].{{cite web|title=Grand Haven Coast Guard Festival|url=http://www.michigan.org/grand-haven-coast-guard-festival/|website=Pure Michigan|publisher=Michigan Economic Development Corporation|accessdate=27 August 2015}}{{cite web|title=About us|url=http://www.coastguardfest.org/#!about-us/cge2|website=coastguardfest.org|publisher=Grand Haven Coast Guard Festival|accessdate=27 August 2015}} As of 2015, 18 cities had been designated as "Coast Guard Cities."{{cite news|last1=Bergman|first1=Julia|title=New London designated as a 'Coast Guard City'|url=http://www.theday.com/article/20150714/NWS01/150719615|accessdate=24 August 2015|work=[[The Day (New London)]]|date=14 July 2015}} ===Legislation=== The authorizing legislation for the Coast Guard City program provides that:{{cite web|title=Public Law 105–383—Nov. 13, 1998|url=https://www.congress.gov/105/plaws/publ383/PLAW-105publ383.pdf|website=[[U.S. Congress]]|publisher=[[Government Printing Office]]|accessdate=25 August 2015}}
The Commandant of the Coast Guard may recognize the community of Grand Haven, Michigan, as "Coast Guard City, USA". If the Commandant desires to recognize any other community in the same manner or any other community requests such recognition from the Coast Guard, the Commandant shall notify the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives 90 days prior to approving such recognition.
===List of Coast Guard Cities=== {| class="wikitable sortable collapsible" border="1"|right |+ |- ! scope="col" | City name ! scope="col" | State ! scope="col" | Date designated |- | [[Grand Haven, Michigan || November 13, 1998 |- | [[Eureka, California|Eureka]] || California || June 3, 2000 |- | [[Mobile, Alabama|Mobile]] || Alabama || July 4, 2002 |- | [[Wilmington, North Carolina|Wilmington]] || North Carolina || July 25, 2003 |- | [[Newport, Oregon|Newport]] || Oregon || March 28, 2005 |- | [[Alameda, California|Alameda]] || California || April 14, 2006 |- | [[Kodiak, Alaska|Kodiak]] || Carolina || May 29, 2015 |- | [[New London, Connecticut|New London]]{{cite news|title=Eagle Docks, New London Celebrates Designation as Coast Guard City|url=http://www.military.com/daily-news/2015/08/18/new-london-celebrates-designation-as-coast-guard-cit.html|accessdate=27 August 2015|work=[[military.com]]|date=18 August 2015}} || Connecticut || July 14, 2015 |} ==See also== *[[Military town]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{US Coast Guard navbox}} [[Category:Cities in the United States]] [[Category:United States Coast Guard]]
